_header: The sun is here in his sign
_description: English verses on the Signs of the Zodiac — three 6-line stanzas and nine quatrains, all in couplets

BodRawD939.First Lines:
þe sonne ys here in his synetat is seson forto
                    reyne…
BodRawD939.Last Lines:
…þat beste wiþ oute lesyngeWol take his mete
                    ascendynge
BodRawD939.Editions:
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “Practical Didactic Works in Middle English.” 
         Diss. Toronto, 1981: 204-8.

NLS1931.First Lines:
The son þat is here in þis seneþat is kyndely seson
                    forto reyneAnd for to frese & to snowe& forto lese is
                    hewos þe pecher turnes vp so downeso dosse þe wedder in
                    þat seson…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…þat is a sene of wordes weyllefew schepe & mony
                    crepand bestes fele
NLS1931.Note: First 6 months only, interspersed with 6477, both written as prose.
NLS1931.Facsimiles:
Hardman,  Phillipa. 
             The Heege Manuscript: A Facsimile of National Library of Scotland MS
                Advocates 19.3.1.
         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.
